name: Davidson Village Inn

reviews.text: I read all the wonderful reviews for the Davidson Inn, and was not disappointed. We loved the Davidson Inn.
reviews.title: Lovely town, lovely inn

likes.liked: — Great location, wonderful service and beautiful large rooms

reviews.text: It's right across the street from Davidson College, which we were there to visit. We spent some time exploring the area, and we fell in love with the town of Davidson. Everyone we encountered was friendly, and seemed happy. Everyone in Davidson must go to the post office to get their mail, which we found incredible. Such a 'feeling' of community. It was the type of town that you feel comfortable, even as a visitor. Other small towns in the area were cute, and friendly, too.
reviews.title: Great Little Town, Great Little Inn
Feels like you're Miles away
reviews.text: The inn is located right off the main street in town. Great location to get to everything. We arrived at night, and we were welcomed by a friendly young man at the front desk. He explained about the extended continental breakfast that was included and served in the morning in the cute little lobby/living room area. He also suggested some places for us to get dinner that night. Very nice guy!

reviews.title: Wonderful newer B and B!
reviews.text: We had no idea what to expect with the room. They do have photos on their website, but we were not sure what room we had reserved, so it was going to be a great surprise. We had a large 2 queen suite. The room was very large! When you first enter there was a small kitchenette to the right, with a frig & a microwave. Then beyond that was a large closet. To the left was the bathroom. The sinks/counters were seperate from the toilet/tub/shower, which was really nice. Lots of counterspace. The room with the toilet/tub/shower was extra large, too.

The bedroom / sitting area of the room was large, too. There were two queen beds, a sofa, an armoir with the tv and a nice big desk. Free internet, and an LCD tv. The details in the room were great, too. Crown molding, nicely painted walls, everything was perfect. I cant imagine anything they could do to make it better.
reviews.title: Heaven

description: An 18 room inn located in the heart of historic downtown Davidson, just across the street from Davidson College. The Inn was newly built in 1993 on the site of the old Maxwell Chambers Inn and features arched windows, high ceilings, its own private library and many more touches of home. Our friendly, genuine staff will make every effort to ensure your stay is a memorable one. Our deluxe continental breakfast buffet and afternoon tea are included with your stay. You can also enjoy a tour of the downtown on the inn's Pedicab. There are lots of great restaurants and shops just around the corner. The Inn is family owned and operated.
